text: <@U1CK6522F|zuowang> has joined the channel

webdaford [3:20 PM]  
...a quick note to announce the availability of a collection of
Ansible playbooks that provision, configure and launch instances of
the Hyperledger Fabric using Consul, Docker, Docker Swarm and Docker
Compose.

The easy to read and understand playbooks can be configured to launch
an arbitrarily sized instance of the Fabric on an arbitrary set of
previously un-configured computers.  Ansible will take care of
provisioning the machines appropriately, and then will automatically
generate a configuration file for Docker Compose to launch the Fabric
instance on Docker Swarm, all triggered with a single command.


Dan Ford
<mailto:dan@keoja.com|dan@keoja.com>
Keoja LLC

<https://github.com/keoja/hyperledger-ansible>

the issue with z is -1 became unresponsive, so I talked with <@U10Q62R8X> and he turned off -2 in the web UI because I wasn’t explicit enough saying which machine has a problem
oops
heh, gotta hate that
yep, killed the one machine that was working!! gah!
and now.. something off with the 'state' of the machine.. killing it says "you cant do it, its stopped", but the start button says.. "no way, you cant start it.. it must be in 'stopped state'"
sysadmin time...

I could wipe the instance completely and create another one.. but I wonder if something is off with the UI... I know the sysadmins like to tinker :slightly_smiling_face: been on calls with them often enough on one project or another
